Posts.Content: All my gifts were pretty well thought out, my fav and most thoughtful was from boyfriend, nothing exciting... but a fleecy throw as he said I am always falling asleep and now I can do so more comfortably
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Its always nice to hear good news its gives the rest of us hope. Now you can really enjoy Christmas... gig hugs and lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: Its always nice to hear good news its gives the rest of us hope. Now you can really enjoy Christmas... gig hugs and lots of love xx
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: excuse my spelling ... its that cooking sherry getting to me
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: excuse my spelling ... its that cooking sherry getting to me
Posts.Title: Finally some good news

Posts.Content: I can only palet pure orange juice, my  Dr suggested milk shakes as you are getting fluids and nutrients for when you have no appetite.... I hate milk but strawberry ones  were ok and do the trick, I feel my thirst quenched but also feel I have eaten Karen x
Posts.Title: What to drink?

Posts.Content: they have one of these where i am being treated, i believe only private patients can have the pleasure
Posts.Title: Please sign this petition to ask the Government to fund Cyberknife...

Posts.Content: Hi Ann I have had 3 Fec  and 2 Tax +Heceptin and any side effects I have had are not until day 3 - 5.   Good Luck
Posts.Title: Chemo starting next Tuesday

Posts.Content: oops meant to say Hi to Jelly too
Posts.Title: T Tips Please

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca I have had two T now and neither have been too bad I will say start taking painkillers as soon as you feel any kind of twinge don't wait, my second T hasn't been at all bad. The thing I don't like is the taste in mouth, and my tongue feeling too big for my mouth and furry, but you seem well prepared.I also find I have no appetite no wanting to  drink so both I force myself I feel constantly full I haven't lost any nails and what hair and eyebrows I had left after Fec haven't thinned any more Overall it is bearable Hope this helps a little, and good luck for tomorrow.
Posts.Title: T Tips Please

Posts.Content: Hi Caryn Am on the mend, I also got some aloe vera gel, and yes it was very soothing x
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy/Aqueous Cream and damaged skin

Posts.Content: That is just pants, I know it's easier said than done but do try not to stress too much,as Misty said others today have had the same and it has proved not to be so worrying.  As for your partner don't wait for him to offer, tell him when your appointment is and tell him to take you, he knows how shaken you have been lately. Fingers  & toes crossed for you,  ....xxx
Posts.Title: Deja vu ????

Posts.Content: Thought I would share this as it may be the same for you. I finished rads two weeks ago, and like so many of you was advised to use aqueous cream generously during and after treatment. Whilst having treatment I was given purilon gel to put onto my skin where my mx wound was still weeping, which I did and this healed very quickly, I was also told to use  this if any other areas broke open. Since then I have had a patch of skin which became incredibly dry and flaky, I continued with the aqueous until Saturday night when it finally split, I began to use the purilon in that area. Today I went to my GP as I wanted her to take a look at the area of skin that had broken down and was weeping slightly and my clothes were beginning to stick , she asked what I had been using and I gave her the info leaflet from the hospital. She told me that aqueous cream is very heavy on detergent and that in some cases it aggreivates the skin rather than soothes and to stop using it immediately. Am glad I went to see her as there are more patches becoming crisp and I hope stopping using the cream will prevent  it from splitting. K
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy/Aqueous Cream and damaged skin

Posts.Content: I didn't know quite what to say, as saxxy has said it so well. Tax is horrid I finished mine in September and it didn't take long to start feeling better (for want of a better word). Please stay strong, sending virtual hugs your way .
Posts.Title: Don't think I can do another round :(

Posts.Content: I too had the watery eyes and went to the dr, she suggested massaging underneath in small circular motions like you do when a baby cries too much,  she said something about stimulating your tear ducts. (must admit i did try this and it didn't work...maybe i didn't do it right) I also have a very painful scabby nose and have got some naseptin from the dr which is marvelous
Posts.Title: Watery Eyes :(

Posts.Content: hi blue tit will take a look, but my bn gave me a swimming boobie aswell as day to day one was you not given one ? x
Posts.Title: Beanie boobie

Posts.Content: hi I bought a lovely swimsuit from marks,they have a few to choose from, mine was £26 you then get 20% off, I have also bought a few of their bras.
Posts.Title: Beanie boobie

Posts.Content: Thanks for the tips  ladies will stock up on all those lovely green veggies. Have got some soup recipes to try which will hopefully help with the anemia and also when I have my chemo Tues as my appetite is rubbish. Am sure if oncologist was worried he would have prescribed something, but thought I would try and help myself. xx
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: Hi  Had pre chemo clinic today and was told my I was a bit anemic, my chemo can go ahead on Tuesday but if it gets any lower I will need a blood transfusion. Any tips to boost my blood count for next time?
Posts.Title: A little Anemic

Posts.Content: Hi  Deb on my planning day I was told about what to expect, I was given aqueous cream and self booking in card. I was laid on the ct scaner, positioned how they wanted me, my arms were placed in stirrups. they then took some measurements, they left the room while the scan took place, When they came back the tattoos were done, tiny scratch and barely visible, I had 3.After that  I was able to ask any questions, a few days later my appointments came in the post. hope this helps , good luck
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy planning

Posts.Content: I am also on Fec -t 3 courses of each , I have done all of Fec and just about to have second Tax and had two periods, now they seem to have stopped
Posts.Title: Periods on fec-t

Posts.Content: Hi Squirell I agree with Sassy, DON'T Panic. Yes Tax was harder than FEC, I never had the sore feet/hands or swollen mouth, or was hospitalised.  I did have joint pain which would start on day 4 and would last 48hrs , but didn't need anything stronger than cocodymol. I painted my nails quite dark and haven't lost any, just are a bit weak and were peeling but that's on the mend. Yes I did have yucky taste buds, but as others have said pineapple really helped. I promise you it is bareable. That all ended in September. We all do cope so differently, big hugs x
Posts.Title: 2 more FEC then 4 tax, i am in pieces worrying

Posts.Content: Hi, I am on Herceptin and have had no side effects. The first one is done slowly over an hour, but you have to stay at the hospital for up to 6 hrs incase of any reactions to it. I now go 3 wkly and it is done in 30 mins. x
Posts.Title: its spread so scared

Posts.Content: No its not that bad, and very do able. It is tougher,than fec,  make sure you take pain relief as soon as you start to feel pain around day 3 for me and take them regularly. I painted my nails dark and didn't loose any. Drink plenty of fluids .listen to your body and rest when you need to. Hope you find it ok x
Posts.Title: Finished fec and start tax on Wednesday but feeling really nervous...

Posts.Content: Okay.....  So it has kicked in, can't say I am in pain BUT I am extremely weak, and very uncomfortable. Worst sleep in a long time.yesterday my hips, knees and ankles were the prob, took co - codamol and that took the edge, was in in bed by 8.30 and could not settle. Just got up 10.30 and feel weak still, still achy in my hips but gone from the rest of my legs, now it is in the tops of my arms and back of my neck, had tablets at 7isih so think it time for the big guns, Tramadol. Can't really explain how I feel ..def not pain, and nothing like anything I experienced on FEC.. Lets hope the day gets better,  on the plus side it's doing its job :)
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies Silly really even reading your kind words made me cry.  Have given myself the proverbial kick up the behind and getting my head focused for the next couple of weeks. Tomorrow to see my GP to renew prescriptions, both for  life as I know it now and some existing  medical problems; and to get referred to the lymphodema clinic.  Then off for my routine echo, this is because I have Herceptin and off to work for a few hours. Tanning begins on Tuesday, these are all late appointments so it will e off to work first then to the hospital. So once again no time to be sitting around feeling sorry for myself. Thanks for listening  xx
Posts.Title: Really fed up

Posts.Content: Hi C Am glad to hear your second Tax is equally good, my next course is Tuesday and this time I am not dreading it at all, although still armed with all drugs. Curious to see if I get the squeaky hiccups again xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Am now on day 4 my legs are a bit stiff/achy but then walked loads yesterday so putting it down to that. I feel no different at the moment to when I was on Fec which is good except the acid reflux was a little worse last night. Fec usually hit me day 5/6 but that was bearable. This time I have strange little squeaky hiccups when I eat  and they  stop when I am finished, I read an article and that could be to do with the steriods for the nausea, so now they have stopped being taken hopefully these hiccups will go to xx Karen xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Vicki I also have injections, they start on day 4 until day 10 - Filigistrim for my white blood cells had them with FEC aswell. I can't do them the other half has to, they sometimes make my bone ache.
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Cat On my planning day I had a scan of the area to be treated, then was tattoed in 3 places  (tiny little dots) then a few days later I received my dates.  I was told what to expect and was given a tube of aqueous cream to rub o twice daily ( i do more when not working). There was a short delay, because of Christmas. I started mine last week am just off to have number 5/15.   Hope all goes well
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy Question

Posts.Content: Hi guys, I was diagnosed in May 2012, so far I have had chemo FEC/T, mx, am having herceptin, started tamoxifen  a couple of weeks ago  and due to start rads on Tuesday. I have coped with all that has been thrown at me but today for some reason I feel really down, anxious about finishing rads and hospital visits slowing down, in case it all come back again. Cannot explain how I feel just not  feeling my normal bubbly self. Sorry to offload, I do try so hard to remain positive. x
Posts.Title: Really fed up

Posts.Content: Thank you Sassy.... I am not great with words and you have summed it up beautifully ............ I don't think I really came to terms/ sunk in that I had breast cancer then everything took over and my life wasn't my own, then I am being told after mx there was no disease detected so before I can come to terms with it it's gone and its all so muddling. Tomorrow is another day and I am sure after tonights wobble i will be as you say ' carpe diem'  xx
Posts.Title: Really fed up

Posts.Content: Haven't much to say except it makes made me feel a little in adequate ,
Posts.Title: Mel B´s "campaign"

Posts.Content: Hi C Glad to hear some nice things about TAX. I had first Tax yesterday and I am armed with all sorts of painkillers and products. Fingers crossed it won't be as bad as I anticipated. Will keep you posted on my progress xx KAREN xx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Clare & Sue Hmmmmm what can I say... when I last wrote it was bearable, day 5 into 6 was  in need of tramadol and with that it was more comfortable. Absolutely no appetite or desire to drink felt very full although my  better half force fed me etc. My tongue felt (still does a bit) fat & furry. By day 7 no need for any pain relief. Today is day 10  feel great want to eat like a horse and am drinking plenty.Although I have to walk slowly  I am stronger than previous days Overall the Fec v Tax  only had 1 - 2 rough days with Fec however symptoms lasted 4 with Tax although uncomfortable with pain relief it was very much do able. So probably about the same. Had 1 now of Tax only 2 to go yayyyyyy  :)  Keep up the good fight ladies x
Posts.Title: Docetaxal for me better than FEC

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I finished chemo in September and have a nice sprinkling of hair returning to its rightful place, my brother in law's girlfriend who is a hairdresser  recommend  Nioxin hair and scalp treatment.  Has anyone tried this or something similar Karen x
Posts.Title: Hair advice pls

Posts.Content: Hi Caroline I am the same as you, my MX is next Tuesday and one minute I am scared stiff the next relieved.   Good luck and hope all is well  x
Posts.Title: all set for mx on fri

Posts.Content: What fab news, now . relax and enjoy x x
Posts.Title: Best Christmas news!

Posts.Content: Hi Abbey I had the port fitted, and felt the same as you 'sick' but was glad I did  go in the end, I must admit I don't like looking or touching it but that is in my head, because there is nothing really wrong with it. To have mine I did have a shot of pethadine and was given a sedative, was also given local and  that was probably the most uncomfortable part of it, I think I made it worse imagining all sorts, but it was fine. Two hours later I had treatment through it I was in hospital most of the day, but felt absolutely fine afterwards. Hope this helps  Karen x
Posts.Title: Worried about having a hickman line...reassurance needed please!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I haven't been on for quite a while now, as I have been trying to get some order back into my life. I have finished Herceptin and yesterday I had my port removed. I feel totally overwhelmed, this time last year I could only dream of this day. Apart from an ultrasound  on Monday and Tamoxifen,  fingers crossed this is it for me. Wishing you all the very best for your journeys. :)
Posts.Title: There is light at the end of the tunnel

Posts.Content: I too will be raising a glass to you all, I will still dip in and out as I was so glad of all the support given to me.  Yes what a class of 2012, one I will never forget. Wow what a year and today is 1 year for me since that bugger was evicted from my body. Onwards and upwards. chin chin. xxxx
Posts.Title: There is light at the end of the tunnel

Posts.Content: What a lovely story to wake up to. My last rads today after chemo,mx, anc, and I feel I have jumped my last hurdle. A few days off work for me now, then just tamoxifen and herceptin for me. big hugs to you all x x
Posts.Title: Turning Corners and a Bit of Inspiration :-)

Posts.Content: my emotions have been all over the place just recently, I am putting it down to another change to treatment. When I got in from my first rads session yesterday I broke down in floods of tears, I think all the anxiety I had been feeling came pouring out. Today after a huge hissy fit at work and another bout of tears, I have come back from session number 2 feeling alot calmer and back in control a bit .  Fingers crossed thats the end of the tears.  Keep up the good fight x
Posts.Title: Last hurdle!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi so that's 1 down . I wasn't told originally but they also did my supraclivicular aswell. Only thing I will say my arm is a little achy and heavy from the lymphodema.  Kate I thought all fluids are good fluids.... water it is . Good luck Eider x x
Posts.Title: Last hurdle!!!!!

Posts.Content: ' Hopefully' Today is the last major hurdle in my treatment regime . Starting 1/15 radiotherapy. am a little anxious. not of the procedure itself but how it will react with my skin. But then I was like this when I began chemo and then before my mx, so I know it is just me. Off to work first then on to hospital. Good luck to any one who is starting something new today x
Posts.Title: Last hurdle!!!!!

Posts.Content: Happy new year......... as with every new year I make lots of promises and they generally last until teatime, no doubt this year will be no different. Chemo complete , mx complete, half way through 15 Herceptin's 3rd week on Tamoxifen and due to start tanning on the 8th. Hair is coming back just look very butch at the minute. Healthy eating begins tomorrow, so far so good. Wishing you all love and hope for 2013  xxx
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: if i could i would treat all us beautiful ladies :)
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: Stoksie- I plan 10 days in Turkey, doing nothing except sunning myself, eating good food and drinking too much. Then hopefully reconstruction all being well x
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: Hi Ali I started on Tamoxifen at the beginning of December the brand I have had is Wockhardt and I have just picked up my next prescription and that was from Boots and is the same. Fingers crossed I have had no side effects, except the odd hot flush, but I was having the odd one anyway.. I am o the mind set now, give me all you have got , if that's what it takes. Good luck x
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen help please

Posts.Content: Hi  I survived on full fat milkshakes, lucozade and ice lollies. I was given difflam mouth rinse, I remember even water tasted foul and couldn't drink coffee at all. As Sue said it doesn't last
Posts.Title: Advice please!

Posts.Content: Hi JacJac  I didn't have nose bleeds but had a bloody nose, if that makes sense, dr said I had weak capillaries, they also became infected, she prescribed naseptin which worked wonders. xx
Posts.Title: Nose bleeds while having chemo

Posts.Content: Hi I also had cancer that was attacking my skin on my breast, and that was why a mastectomy was required. when its time for reconstruction skin will be grafted from else where  on me .
Posts.Title: Breast cancer in skin

Posts.Content: Well here it is until a few days ago I was not looking forward to today. Now I am counting my blessings am going to enjoy the next few days with my family and forget about my illness. God bless you all, and for those of you who can't enjoy the festivities I hope you find your spirit again, because you are beautiful inside and out and have been such a great help to us who joined here scared and helpless . x x
Posts.Title: The day some of us have dreaded

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies A bit late in the day to be asking, I am off to do the radiotherapy planning day (today), I have been told what to expect and that I will have a scan. Question - is this like the CT scan where you have to drink the barium liquid before hand ?   Thank in advance
Posts.Title: Pre Radiotherapy Question

Posts.Content: Thanks Nicky I hated that stuff , left me really queasy, that's a relief .   xx
Posts.Title: Pre Radiotherapy Question

Posts.Content: Hi Caryn, they were not overly worried, just said that because I already had chemo it was slowing healing down. The Dr was hopeful we would be ready to rock next week. xx
Posts.Title: Pre Radiotherapy Question

Posts.Content: Hi I was told by my BCN and other ladies on here about the dark nail varnish, its because the Docetaxel discolours your nails and they can be known to fall out. I had my first treatment last Monday and so far so good XX Karen XX
Posts.Title: Black nail varnish & Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Thanks Michelle sat there for 3hrs only to be told my wound wasn' t healed enough and to come back next week. However didn' t leave empty handed they decided to start me on Tamoxifen. x x
Posts.Title: Pre Radiotherapy Question

Posts.Content: I had right mastectomy and node clearance on Tuesday. I was so scared, they had a difficult job getting a line in, and am covered in bruises, eventually they used one for babies in my foot to get me to sleep then put one in the large vein in my neck. All seems to have gone well, no drain was fitted, I was glued then stitched, pain is minimal and as a result I was sent home the next  day. As I said before I was scared but everyone was lovely,  So that is another part of my road to recovery complete. :)
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and node clearance all done

Posts.Content: Thank you  I don't plan on doing too much, I worked right through my chemo so plan to use this time to get all my strength back as my red cell count is still quite low. I have been very lucky so far ( if that doesn't sound silly)  I have had a great  supportive network.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy and node clearance all done

Posts.Content: Hi Chelle I had mine drained twice, I felt so much better for it, it doesn't hurt . I agree contact your bn
Posts.Title: Seroma after mastectomy
